Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: blackthorn11
Reviews.Content: This charming little hotel is between the Rialto bridge and San Marco Plaza. It is convenient to everything. The breakfasts were short on variety and fresh fruit, but the convenience of the location made up for it. It is easy to get lost in Venice, but this hotel, right behind the San Zulian church, was a snap to find. I am very happy we found this place.

Reviews.Title: “A Three Star Hotel with a Five Star Feel”
Reviews.Author: jennyjtourofEU
Reviews.Content: My mother came to visit me from the U.S. so I decided to take her to Venice. Venice is known to be notoriously expensive so I researched hotels through recommendations from friends. One friend recommended this hotel so I booked. I booked only a week in advance so we had to get the rate that included breakfast so paid 20 euros more than I had previously seen on their website so I recommend you book early to get the best rates. Definitely book the room without breakfast as you are better off paying 5 euros each for a crossiant and cafe at a bar nearby. This hotel is perfectly located only 300 meters from San Marco square. Makes it easy to tour around and if you need a break or shower, it is easy to get back. The staff was very welcoming when we arrived and always courteous throughout our stay. Even though we arrived at 1 p.m., our room was already ready and they immediately showed us to our room (and even carried our luggage!). The room was simple but clean. The shower had good water pressure and was hot. The only reason I gave it 4 stars and not 5 was the breakfast is not the best--canned fruit, packaged crackers and coffee from a generic coffee machine (not espresso from a real espresso machine that is so good in Italy). They did have some fresh bread and crossiants and nutella so that saved the day:) Also the pillows are hard as rocks...we would have requested new ones but it was too late and so we just used the ones supplied. The hotel also offered us a free water taxi ride to Murano island...it was a wonderful treat but beware as they must have a deal with the glass factory there because there is big pressure to buy there...it is not just an informative tour. I recommend taking the public boat for 6.50 and touring around Murano yourself. It will be much more enjoyable and cheaper (the factory is NOT cheaper than the stores on Murano). Overall, a wonderful hotel and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a wonderful gem”
Reviews.Author: lisa026
Reviews.Content: I honestly dont know why this hotel does not get a better rating, should be very much higher up on the tripadvisor rating. I have written reviews before on this as it is MY hotel for whenever I am in Venice but since I just returned I wanted to write one more. First off, as confusing as Venice is, so very easy to get lost there, this hotel is pretty easy to find. Go to San Marcos, with the church on your right, go under the clock tower, first right, second left ( there is a shoe store where you need to turn) and straight ahead for a minute or so. Plenty of little cafes and shops around this charming little square.The hotel itself is small but totally wonderful. The rooms I have stayed in so far, and guessing they are all like that, have the true Venician decor, very charming and I would hate it would it be all modern in a city like this. The beds are too comfy, I sleep wayyyyyyyyy too long there, and having the breakfast delivered to your room is so nice. You can also go down for it in a room just off the lobby but I got all I needed, tea, coffee, bread, cerials, fruit and more. Set me up for the day. I also love the bonus of the free wii fii, my pet peeve are hotels that charge for this and there are a lot of them in Italy but this is a bonus and worked 100% of the time. An issue I would like to adress is I see a lot of people that comment here are less then happy with the staff at the hotel. I will tell you that from my experience, they have always, always, been more then helpful and very kind. In fact, I doubt I would still be going to Venice if not for this staff, in fact many of them are now actually friends. Please check into this hotel with an open mind about them and I hope you find them as friendly as I do. There is also a supermarket close by, not very common in the city, just leave the hotel to the left, over the brigde, first left after then and you are there in a sec. And since the hotel does not have that stupid USA tradition of whatever you take out of the frigde, you will be charged for, you can restock at your will. Came in handy for me since I was buying chesse and such that needed to be stored. Only thing I can say about the hotel that I did not care for, were the bells. There is a church right next door, and the bells go off at 10 AM. And last for a good few minutes. This will not matter to most people but since I have was having a very good sleep in that lovely bed, it could get a little annoying while charming. But San Zulian will always be the hotel for me while in the city and I hope you enjoy it as much as I do. Thank you SZ and a special thank you to Daniele, a front desk member who really goes out of his way to make the stay enjoyable. Great job everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in great location, just make sure to ask for room 304”
Reviews.Author: dreamingfish
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a fantastic three night stay at the San Zulian. Per some previous reports, try and get room 304. It's in the attic and does have some steps (in addition to the elevator) so isn't suitable for disabled guests, but for everyone else, it probably has one of the best rooftop views in Venice. The room was small but perfectly adequate. It has small windows on both sides and a small study/sitting room up 3 steps from the bedroom. This great room has windows on three sides overlooking the rooftops towards St Marks and the Grand Canal. Breakfast is basic but filling - cereals, fruit salad, yogurts and a cheese, ham and salami platter. On our third day we overslept a little and the breakfast staff, having noticed we hadn't been down, actually called the room to let us know they would be clearing up breakfast in 10 minutes, then proceeded to stay open until we got Down stairs and had eaten. - you really can't complain about such good service We found all the reception staff to be very friendly and helpful. Most were happy to suggest places to eat and things to see, even where to go to barter the best gondola deal! The location is very good. Only a couple of minutes from St Marks. ( walk through the arch by the shops (with Doges palace in your right) take first road on your right, second on your left and San Zulian os on the corner diagonally on your right. )

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: travellight4489
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel with a perfect location. It was difficult to find but I think most hotels would be difficult to find in Venice. Perhaps a guide service to your hotel would be used quite a lot. LOVED Venice. all of the family loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Our trip to Venice Novmber 2011”
Reviews.Author: BMWZ465
Reviews.Content: Our original hotel booking to another hotel was cancelled and so we had to search for another place to stay. Having read the reviews (mixed) we booked San Zulian. Our room was clean and pleasant for our 4 night stay as was the en-suite (shower was brilliant). Staff were polite and friendly (as we were to them) - breakfast catered for all needs and on the last day we had this in our room (plenty of choice on the tray). Only moan was the coffee which was grim so we changed this for tea (no problem). The hotel is ideally located for visiting all the tourists spots as it is close to San Marco Square but away from all the crowds (although in November there were few tourists). There is a small church next to the hotel and on the first night we woke up to the bells 'going like the clappers' at midnight - thought that the end of the world had come! so be prepared for this. Opposite the hotel is a charming bar and next door but one to the hotel is the San Zulian restaurant which is highly recommended www.trattoriasanzulian.it is not to be confused with the bar next door to the hotel which overcharged us for our drinks. November is a good time to visit Venice and we were very lucky with the weather however be aware that in the tourist areas there is nowhere to sit/rest other than a bar. However if you walk further out of these areas there are some lovely parks and benches.

Reviews.Title: “really bad - now called the Albergo San Zulian, so beware”
Reviews.Author: Pam L
Reviews.Content: first time in Venice and this happens . . . still a great city and I will go back, but never to this hotel or it's affiliate, Palazzo Schiavoni. Breakfast was canned fruit and thin pieces of ham and cheese and bad coffee. In the room I found a broken (dirty) fingernail on the table, the bathroom smelled like cigarette smoke in the evening, the bar down stairs was a bit noisy, and all complaints fell on deaf ears. Once I came back to the 24 hour front desk and no one was there and the front door locked. Only good thing was the free internet.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID”
Reviews.Author: ShirleyValentineSr
Reviews.Content: Single travellers get used to the left over rooms but this was absolutely the worst. Small I can do with no problem but small and dreary is difficult to manage for 3 days. Then add the surly staff. They always seemed annoyed that you were bothering them with questions.This hotel is well over-due for a renovation. I checked their pictures before I started writing the review and they certainly don't show my room. They should be required to date their pictures. The dining area shown appears to be a room when in fact it is a small hall/alcove off the elevator. It is obviously an after-thought and too small to accommodate the hotel. I was informed I was having breakfast in my room. As I enjoy meeting people when travelling I asked to eat in the dining "room" and was prefunctorily refused. No choice. My room was on the 3rd floor and when the elevator arrived at the 3rd floor there was a flight of stairs to my room. Surprise! There was one miniscule window over-looking roofs which blocked any hope of natural light. The paint was flaking from the walls in the bathroom and the material covered headboard was worn and stained. The bathroom had a strange low alcove off the shower area with a light. Something like a lit crawl space??? (I took a picture but don't know how to post). The room was in need of painting but the linen and bathroom were clean so I persevered. Breakfast was just okay. Buns, yogurt, coffee. I didn't even get offered the free trip to Murano but i went on my own and echo the other comments. Don't waste your time. I am rating a 2 for location only but I do think Venice is so small every location is a good one. Avoid, Avoid, Avoid!

Reviews.Title: “OK but can be a better deal”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Papa
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here in October 2011. We had a 4-person bedroom. Now compared to some other accommodation we have had for four persons like in Florence in Italy, this room was way too small and we paid much more than in Florence!! One of the main problems in the hotel is the very small area allocated for breakfast. This create a bit of chaos every morning. There was not a single morning we had to wait until a table is set for breakfast (although the waiting time was around 10 minutes). But can be difficult with kids to wait for breakfast! The staff was nice and pleasant. The staff at the check in counter was rather formal (except the younger guy we saw one day). As other reviewers have indicated, yes, they do arrange free trip to a Murano Glass Factory, which was an amazing experience. We were taken by a free water taxi, which took about 15 minutes to get there and return trip by normal boat took about 45 minutes. One small thing about the hotel: There was a LCD TV in the room, which never worked. I reported day after day, but nothing was done. Once they told me that it would fixed next day, but was not done. Now we all know we do not go to Venice to watch TV. But when you have kids and also want to follow news briefly, it is good to have a "working TV." One of the main pluses of the hotel is its location: proximity to San Marco Square. But San Marco Square is the most crowded place in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Venetian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Julie1952
Reviews.Content: First of all, you have to find it. Our family of three (one teenager) was determined NOT to pay 80 Euros ($100) for a private water taxi and took the Vaporetto (public water bus) to San Marks Square. I had looked up the map location and the verbal description by the hotel on how to find them (Venice's charm is small winding streets and no car traffic) I was able to navigate to within 10 feet of the hotel with the instructions and sending my 18 year old on the final exploration mission found our hotel tucked away on a quiet corner within a few minutes. The room was small but adequate and the air conditioning was blessedly top rate. (Hot and sweltering outside.) The bathroom small but adequate. The breakfast room is tiny but adequate. The main charm is the location, near Marks Square. By this time of our European tour we were all tired of tours and sightseeing, so we spent hours wandering down alleyways, plazas, over bridges, windowshopping and people watching. Fabulous! Getting "lost" in Venice is a never-to-be-missed experience. Just know where your closest landmark is (St Mark's Square) and you'll find your way home.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: NZTrev
Reviews.Content: The Hotel San Zulian in Venice is very well located and while not cheap does include breakfast in its tariff. Its rooms are typical European size i.e. fairly small (but not as small as some we have been in) but it is well decorated and has efficient air conditioning. We would stay here again if we ever come back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “At last, a real hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Vasgo
Reviews.Content: Perfectly situated between San Marco and the Grand Canal. After far too many business trips in anodyne chain hotels, the San Zulian is charming. Venice passes right outside the door and sitting in the early evening with a glass of wine is a great way to end the day. The hotel is perfectly placed to explore San Marco, or the more interesting ( and far less crowded and expensive) San Polo and San Croce. The Antica Birraria La Corte in Campo San Polo (San Polo) does the best Pizzas in Venice and has a lovely tree shaded patio, you need to get there early evening or make a reservation (It's very popular). Get up early and walk into St Marks Square when it's empty, except for the models on photo-shoots, much better than trying to fight your way through the cruise ship herds later in the day. If you get tired of paying Â£3 for a coke or Â£2 for a bottle of water, turn left out of the hotel, walk over the canal, straight on to the hardware shop, turn left and there is a COOP (Supermarket).

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: tony255907
Reviews.Content: Recommended by travel agent and lived up to our expectations as a small comfortable hotel in a great location for the sights of San Marco. Not that easy to find late at night but fortunately when we arrived a transfer by water taxi delivered us to the door.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but very outdated rooms”
Reviews.Author: va408
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs a major upgrade. The beds were very uncomfortable and the room were below average. The location was decent but Venice is so small that any where you stay is a walking distance to major attractions. For the price we paid I expected more. The staff was not helpful. The day we were checking out they asked us if anyone told us a tour of the city was included in our reservation. I was quite shocked since no one mentioned it. I will not stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Always stay at the San Zulian”
Reviews.Author: kathie2154
Reviews.Content: Best location just behind San Marco . Wonderful reception, small intimate hotel. Make sure you stay on 1st or second floor to avoid street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Not so friendly”
Reviews.Author: Rrodent
Reviews.Content: Great Location however I dont think you can get a bad location in Venice. We booked a triple room however they tried to squeeze us into a double room with cheap wire bed as a third which hadn't been made up. Only after discussion were we given the correct room we paid for - which happened to be the room next door! Service was very plain except for the one helpful gentlemen from housekeeping. Probably would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: MomOfThing1Thing2
Reviews.Content: I was surprised by this hotel. I had reserved it based on the reviews here, but it exceeded my expectations. It was efficient, clean, in an excellent location, with modern faucets, option of breakfast in bed and an elevator! We couldn't ask for more. Breakfast in room was convenient with young kids. It was a basic breakfast but kids loved the yogurt. Got a great deal on Expedia. The only con was that it was hard to find. Mostly because its hard to find streets in Venice as street names are not visible everywhere. We paid an extra 10 euros to get dropped nearby in water taxi. If you do not have much of luggage/kids, the Piazza Marco stop is close by. You do not need to take a private taxi to get dropped off at Piazza Marco. Also note that a twin or single bed in Italy is much smaller than the US. Room has a free safe, and they give you the keys to the safe on request. Tip: The street the hotel is on is hidden behind a small church, and its called Albergo San Zulian, not Hotel San Zulian.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ddrCanada
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked with their sister hotel and then we were redirected here. The location of this hotel is excellent, within a minute walk from St. Marks Square. Very easy to find. The hotel was quite pricey but everything in Venice is expensive. The rooms were decent but the bed wasn't very comfy and the walls of the hotel were paper thin and we got in trouble for being too loud. Breakfast was basic but good, it was delivered to our hotel room on time both mornings. Venice has little to no nightlife. Wireless cost 20 Euro but was given to us for free because of the switch in hotels (I think)

Reviews.Title: “Location is perfect...very close to St. Marks Square”
Reviews.Author: April008
Reviews.Content: Venice is a maze, and is very easy to get lost although you can't get too lost on an island. It was nice that this hotel was very close to St. Marks Square since all signs in Venice direct you here. Once you find the square it is only a one minute walk to the hotel. I found it to be expensive for what you got but I think that in Venice everything is extremely expensive. The walls are quite thin so we (a group of 6) got scolded by the staff for being loud at night. Also the bed and pillow are not comfortable at all and I am not a fussy person.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Brusselsgirl
Reviews.Content: We really apreciated our stay at San Zulian, the staff was very friendly, the room was large and clean. breakfast was fine. Location is excellent, a few steps away from San marco and only a few minutes wlak from the rialto. Plenty of shops and restaurants (not at the hotel) We would definitely stay there again should we go back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: maverick1967
Reviews.Content: This is a good little hotel in a great location, minutes from both St Marks Sq and the Rialto bridge. A basic breakfast is included and for no charge you can have it served in bed which is a bonus. Venice can be expensive but we found plenty of nice places that were cheap just off the main square you just need to walk around and you will see the prices drop.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MPBEHOWARD
Reviews.Content: My wife, 22-year-old daughter and I stayed at this hotel in late December 2010 for two nights. Our room was spacious, clean, and well appointed. Breakfast (tea/coffee, juice, rolls/butter/jam, fresh ham) was brought to our room at no extra charge, right on time each morning - with a smile. The reception area was attended by polite, formal, professional, unusually well-dressed male staff. We noticed that the tourist area, where San Zulian is so well-placed, is generally quite security-conscious, and we felt comfortable with the hotel's formidable reception area. The hotel was very good value for money and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “As a travelor I count on people's honest feedback from their experiences, don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: 1_Honest_Review
Reviews.Content: First night in Italy on our honeymoon...I enjoy camping just as much as the next guy, but when my beautiful new bride looked over at me and asked if I'd mind if she slept clothed because of the filthy room, I knew we had to find a new hotel. We paid for three nights and left without any refund after the first night. I've stayed in cleaner places in Kenya. Travelers, you've been advised.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: wilsden
Reviews.Content: It took us ages to actually find the hotel due to the confusing signage systems in Venice. Well located close to St Marco square and water taxi service. the room was ok, fairly large and on the ground floor so no problems with bags etc. A large tiled bathroom that was very slippery when wet, the shower sent water all over the room. Breakfast was just average, fruit, cereal juice coffee etc. Free wifi was a bonus, but we found that you cannot have an iron in your room [in Italy] so clothes were a bit of a mess. Service from the front desk varied from ok to 'couldn't care less' Some where to sleep, conveniently located, would not hurry back.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Colorado020
Reviews.Content: The things that were disappointing was the fact we had to enter our room through a back dark alley and ring a bell. Sometimes it was answered promptly and sometimes we rang again and again. The men who worked at the desk were not visitor friendly. The key worked very poorly in the lock - the key had to be turned in to them when you went out. The room needed some upkeep - loose toilet seat,ect. The breakfast was fair. The lobby is small. The only positive thing I could say was that it had a close location to the main square.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: d4etver
Reviews.Content: We spend 3 days there. Nice and clean rooms, good breakfast, and we got very goog expressions of tis hotel!

Reviews.Title: “very poor hotel, service non existant, room small, no money spent on up keep, much better value in area”
Reviews.Author: gromit01
Reviews.Content: we spent five nights in venice, in a selection of holtels, (due to not booking in advance) and this was by far the worst, take this from a guy that does not mind staying in hostels on trips, there much better value in the area look at the top 35 on tripadvisor under 250$ , why so bad, bed room like a shoebox, old and smell of damp. Service at receiption was ok on checkin, but the gut on the evenings thinks his above the job, and is offiended to deal with customers, the only good thing in fact is the location

Reviews.Title: “Not really 3 stars”
Reviews.Author: LizVeniceFl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights before leaving on a cruise. Well, the beds were so hard and uncomfortable there was no sleep. The room was shabby albeit clean. The shower stall was so small that if you dropped your soap you had to open the shower door to pick it up (no I am not a large person.) There is no water door so you have to drag your baggage from the landing point to the hotel. The day front desk man was delightful but the evening man was surly and rude. Even the simplest request (how do I get an outside line) was met with ill temper and huffing and puffing. However, its very close to all the main attractions and there is a great restaurant right down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location....May 4 - 10, 2010”
Reviews.Author: EdinVermont
Reviews.Content: The San Zulian has a near perfect location to explore Venice. You are close to San Marco and the Rialto or you can strike out to the north or east with ease through Castello. The staff is warm and accommodating in every way. There is a great little restaurant called Cavitappi connected to the hotel and for a late night (10:30 in Venice) glass of wine there's a restaurant two doors down that's open until 11:00pm. Don't believe all the crap from the one recent review. Those people sound like demanding and inflexible curmudgeons that no one could ever satisfy! This is a polite and very comfortable boutique hotel. The trip to Murano is worth it just to get a great ride in one of those beautiful water taxis. Beware....it's right to the dock of a very big and expensive glass factory. After the glass blowing demonstration, it's ...."Now, may I take you to our showroom". The sales pitch is almost laughably intense. Don't look too interested in anything and get out of there as soon as you can. Other shops in Murano are much more intimate and have way more affordable things, (though no one was buying anything as the Euro was dropping like a stone). This is not an excursion paid for by the hotel, it's merely a service provided to many hotels to get the tourist into this particular showroom. In fact, the staff at the San Zulian seemed kind of reluctant to have their guests subjected to this freebee. I can understand why. Oh, also.....you're on your own to get back but that's easy on the vapparetto. Go to the Faro stop and buy a ticket in the little tobacco store. Stamp it....or wave it in front of the ticket meter to activate it. It helps to watch others do this first. Have a great time in Venice and stay more than 2 days....there's lots to see!

Reviews.Title: “highly avoidable, unless you like tobe insulted and like to torture yourself...”
Reviews.Author: loonytraveller
Reviews.Content: I shudder when i think of this hotel and write this review, but here is my experience, believe it, if you want, but you have been warned.! I found italy to be a beautiful place with warm friendly people, lovely places and some amazing sites with good hotels. I have travelled extensively all around the world and have faced some really good and some really terrible places, but this hotel takes the cake for rude behaviour, inhuman treatment to guests (or should i say inmates in a concentration camp or jail cells) and 'service" which would, probably any other normal hotel, would prefer to shut down than subject its guests to such behaviour. had booked for 2 nights, for 2 adults and 2 kids,had to take a junior suite, since they insisted on this for size of room for the family. When reached there, and checked in, was shocked to discover rooms airconditioning was not working. was told that some govt rule for all aircon units to be switched off, till may end!! and hence no airconditioning! I said that their website details on expedia (through whom i had booked) had no mention of this, and instead mentioned all rooms were airconditioned or comfortably airconditioned... the receptionist just laughed and said must be a mistake! i I protested and said that i had paid full price for airconditioned rooms and if i had known, this in advance or even at the time of checkin, i would have gone somewhere else, but he just shrugged and said something in italian.. since i had paid in advance and in full, i did not want to shift out, and stayed there... spent two nights sweating away, as we could not slept with the windows open, since there were some drainage pipes alongside the window, and the family was scared to leave these windows open.... and we almost suffocated sleeping (while we could) and spent the balance time keeping watch while the windows were open for some short periods, in the night, so that the kids could sleep.... the room was dingy, and depressing, old worn out furniture, skimpy blankets and sheets, decent rooms and bathrooms but not what to expect for the price,had to scamper around for plugs for recharging my laptop/phone(it seemed as if all the plug points were blocked by some blank plates) and the toilets were not working, and had to get this fixed myself, since housekeeping was not receptive. no inroom tea/coffee, change of receptionists every day, so we saw new ones everytime we passed by. when we asked for the free tour to murano, we were told first that the timing was not appropriate (2pm in the noon) and we should probably cut short our earlier scheduled walking tour so that they could offer this to us... We did and the receptionist rather grudgingly, after a lot of grumbling arranged a tour for us at 1.15 in the afternoon. breakfast was some breads, cereals,juices and yogurt, and the service here was pleasantly nice. I had asked for an early checkout to catch a train at 8.00 and was told that the breakfast would be served only at 7.30 and i should see, if the maid had come at that time,and see what i could get at the time. on the day of checkout, i saw a couple of guys sitting for breakfast at 7am,and sat down to grab a sandwich and a cup of tea. the maid was surprised and called in an old man, who asked us to get up and not sit for breakfast since they could not serve us. when i asked why, he told us that they could not serve us, and we would have to come back at 7.30. i just said that my kids wanted to grab a glass of milk and we were off. since they had already started eating, i was not willing to go and heard this guy shouting away. when i checked out, the same guy kept on shouting in italian, and charged me 20 euros per day for the "breakfast" for my 3 year old!! for the 2 days. when i asked for the reservation paper he was showing me, i asked for a copy to take the matter up with expdia, he refused, and gave me a receipt for the extra charge only after i refused to pay without a receipt. i was rather shell shocked at this attitude, but was having the train to catch, and was a little harrowed trying to get a family to the station first thing in the morning, hence i just paid and left, else would have argued on this matter. the most unpleasant matter in my entire trip, and have taken the matter up with expedia, for the non airconditioned rooms and the extra breakfast charge, but have not heard anything from them. would not recommend this hotel EVER ! and would strongly discourage anyone from staying here, atleast i would not.

Reviews.Title: “A Peaceful and Comfortable Stay right at the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: benakm
Reviews.Content: I remembered it took me quite a while to find this hotel even though it is situated at the center of Venice at San Marco. This hotel is located at a corner of a junction, however, the little pathways of Venice make it harder to spot. Nevertheless, staying here was a good choice I have made as it is near to the main attractions of Venice. Most of the hotel staff were very friendly and warm. I remembered the lady who delivered our breakfast to our room, it was tough on her to climb up to the attic where we were staying that has better view of Venice. Amazingly, she gave a very happy and warm smile while panting. The hotel room is basic but cosy. The interior decorations were venetian and furnised with antique furniture. When the sun sets at night, the streets of Venice is so peaceful and quiet that I almost felt as if I was in some deserted planet. In addition, Venice can be very dark at night. All these factors add up to the romance meter and strong venetian culture that makes this hotel an ideal place to stay in. The only problem I had was with the wireless connection. I had to bring my laptop down to the lobby area as the room I was staying in have hardly any network.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: JeannieColaSC
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in St. Mark's Square. Less expensive than most I looked at and it was really pretty with nice views. Comfortable beds and very quiet. Good breakfast. They offered free transportation to the the glass factory but we were leaving too early for Florence to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but....”
Reviews.Author: Holly34
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night at the hotel in early September before going on our cruise around the Greek Islands. We arrived just on dusk. We had been to Venice the week before on a Trafalgar Tour and located the hotel then, so we knew how to get there. It was very easy to find thanks to someone on trip advisor explaining an easy way to get there. The hotel is only a few minutes walk from St Markâ€™s Square and itâ€™s a true Venetian style hotel. When checking in we got a not so friendly man on the front desk which was a little disappointing, our room was located right near the lift which was a little bit noisy but nothing to complain about. The room was very cute, small and very Venetian and clean as all hotels are in Europe. After checking in we went out for dinner on the waters edge near St Markâ€™s Square, it was beautiful. When coming back to the hotel there was another person at the desk and he was much friendlier, thank goodness because we were dreading seeing the same man. We had breakfast included it was just ok. The breakfast room is so small I wouldn't like to see it if the hotel was fully booked. You can have breakfast in-room though. We didn't have much of a view but we were only there for 1 night so we didn't mind. When we go back to Venice we won't be staying at this hotel again, we will try another hotel. The location was great but I would like to see other hotels on Venice island. Things to do in Venice: Do a gondola through the lovely canals to the Grand Canal itâ€™s absolutely beautiful, visit Murano Glass factory and buy yourself some Murano glass, visit the island of Burano itâ€™s a 45 minute boat ride from St Markâ€™s Square & itâ€™s just gorgeous with very friendly locals. Lunch at Romano's restuarant on Burano, it's beautiful food and wine. Get a gelati or two in St Markâ€™s Square, visit the Basilica in St Markâ€™s Square walk to Rialto Bridge, catch a water bus itâ€™s a fun experience & just enjoy the beauty of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: sonfollower
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location for San Marco Square. It is in a quiet location and therefore there were no disturbances of sleep. Our room (number 2) in San Zulian was separate from the main hotel. We had to go outside, round the back, use a bell entry system, climb some steep stairs before entering our room which was very clean and basically comfortable. It had three windows which were good for ventilation, but no view. The ensuite shower room was adequately functional but unsuitable for 'large' people. Breakfast was the same every day and consisted of crusty rolls and croissants with the same cold ham and cheese. There was no fruit but there was fruit juice, sparkling water and a choice of hot drinks. I would recommend this hotel for location and if you are looking for a 'no frills' holiday. Also, bear in mind this hotel does get flooded during the rainy periods. The hotel stays open during this time and the extremely friendly and helpful staff work around this problem.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: libbyanne
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room on ground floor close to reception area. Hotel room small with large bathroom. Only outlook was through double stained glass windows covered with louvres to enclosed courtyard with table and chairs and also was a smoking area. Not very private. Breakfast delivered to room each morning was very basic. Location was great, close to San Marco and great for shopping. If visiting Venice again I would definately upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great price!”
Reviews.Author: Ireland782
Reviews.Content: Price aside the hotel wasn't really anything to write home about. But we were on a budget and this hotel was all we could get in the location at a price we could afford. It was in a perfect quiet location close to St Marks square and close to Rialto. Situated beside a beautiful church too. The staff were very helpful and the rooms were spotlessly clean, although on first impressions the rooms looked quite "basic" that may be the norm in Venice. Breakfast is delivered to the room F.O.C. every morning which is a nice touch IMHO This was much more than a "budget" hotel, it was good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Easy to find”
Reviews.Author: TinsyWinsy
Reviews.Content: The directions to this hotel were perfect...so much so, that when we got off the vaporetto, and I led my little troop (2 sisters and a niece) straight to the hotel, my niece was convinced I had been there before! The room was quite nice, not too big, but not too cramped either, for 4 people. It looked recently renovated, and the bathroom also seemed decent. No view though, which was ok, because we were anyway never in the room. The breakfast was crap though, they sent it up to our room, and consisted only of some hard buns and insipid coffee..of course, being in Venice, we had some amazing gelato and tiramisu at the various places dotted everywhere..so not really a great issue. Some sustenance would have been nice though. The staff was ok, not too helpful, but not rude/indifferent either...they let us leave our bags in the hotel after checkout till evening, just didnt seem like they were too safe, as they were left in the open, and not in a luggage store room..infact, both, my and niece's suitcase didnt seem to open when we picked up our suitcases in the evening, so it seemed someone may have tried to fiddle with them, but since nothing was lost, I will give them the benefit of the doubt. All in all, the experience at the hotel was decent, nothing really to complain about. However, one comment on Venetians, for a city that so depends on tourism for its living (and seems to be drowning), the Venetians sure seem to have a tremendous amount of attitude, and very little respect for the tourists. I had a big show down with a Murano glassware shopkeeper, who thought I should buy a 500 Euro vase instantly, with no thought..I gave him a piece of my mind, and told him that while he may not value his products, and think they can be bought like groceries, I did value them, and hoped to keep it in my house like a prized possession...and it was just too sad and bad if he didn't. That shut him up suitably!!!

Reviews.Title: “The darkest smallest room in the hotel with no clothing drawers”
Reviews.Author: DistrictValuer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for six nights and reception remarked how long we would be with them. Usually two/three nights is the norm. We were given room 101-note that number-and the rooms above us may be as small and dark.We were not happy about it from the start but assumed that the hotel must be full. We should probably have gone down and made a fuss but we were tired after our two flights to get to Venice. The room window looked out on to an enclosed area but the adjacent building walls meant that the room had very little natural light. There was no chest of drawers or places to put clothing so we lived out of our suitcase for the six days. some noise from the lift, frequently at around 2:00 am. Staying six nights the hotel should have given us a much better room with a chest of drawers. Late in the holiday we discovered that the hotel was not full and had lovely large rooms with big windows. Clean enough and a modern but tiny bathroom. Breakfast was in a narrow room and will be a shambles if the hotel is full but we believe that breakfast in your room can be requested free of charge. We simply wanted a decent room. We shall never go back. Other central hotels are much better, we have been to five others. My advice would be not to touch this unless you can specify your room.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible treatment”
Reviews.Author: XPD55
Reviews.Content: Well in advance of our trip to Venice we booked two rooms at hotel SanZulian because of the location. One of us being elderly (85 years) we wanted accomodation next to San Marco. Without any apperent reason (this was before the floods that occured later in 2008) and without any explanation they put us up in a completely different place! Nothing wrong with this second hotel as such but it was located some distance away (in Castello). They also gave no notice - we only learnt about the shift because we took contact with them for another reason the day before our arrival. Finally they refused to give any reduction of the price for the inconvenience they caused us. I would never trust SanZulian again!!

Reviews.Title: “Room with no view”
Reviews.Author: wanderingstarlet
Reviews.Content: After being almost put off all week, from travelling to Venice, due to the unprecedented flood level, we decided to just go anyway and take our wellie`s. What a great decision. The sight of St Mark`s square on arrival on Friday evening December 5th, although it was quite dark and drizzling with rain, the spectacle was breathtaking and just had to be gawped at ! We went into a jewellery shop on the square to ask the assistant if he knew our hotel, and although he didn`t know of it, he went out of his way, coming out of the shop to see if there were any true Venetians to help us. There weren`t any locals but we asked at another hotel and although she drew a map for us we still got lost finding the Co-op Travel`s version of Julian. It was really Zulian. On arrival, the gentleman at the check in desk was so so helpful, in fact I could not fault any of the staff, - they gave us directions superbly when we asked them. The only criticism and certainly disappointment was the room. It was accessed via a small courtyard where anybody who worked at the hotel could go and have a cigarette. There was no wardrobe, the floor was marble, and I was absolutely frozen, in fact spent quite a lot of time in the bathroom as it was warmer. I have looked at the photographs of the rooms in the brochure and ours was absolutely nothing like it, but when I asked if all the rooms were the same, I was told they were. I suggested to my partner that I thought I could hear seagulls, but I didn`t think they could fly as far inland, but, as we didn`t have a window to look out of, we thought we would need a periscope to find out. ! Anybody who is going bear this in mind and specificy that you do not want to go in either of the two `new` rooms on the ground floor. Claustrophobics beware. The food in venice was quite disappointing, leading on one occasion, to my partner insisting that the service charge be removed from the bill. There WAS no service and the food was slung at us, English, American and Irish seemed to be the worst served. We found another restaurant which was absolutely superb and I shall quote both when I have found the bill. The one disappointment to me about this wonderful trip, was not being able to see out at either the lagoon, or any one of the zillions of waterways that litter the island, and for which it is famous. Incidentally, the Carnival show is absolutely excellent, as are also the musicians of the Vivaldo concerts being pamphleted throughout the streets Take the time to enjoy it and take your walking shoes..

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way but near to everything”
Reviews.Author: Fentz
Reviews.Content: This little hotel was a true treasure. We arrived in Venice during a downpour and were completely drenched. We arrrived at the hotel 2 hrs before check in. The desk manager told us that check in was noon, but looked at the four of us with pity and offered us two rooms on the first floor immediately. We were thrilled with the rooms, which overlooked a little courtyard, and the cleanliness. They were nicely appointed, well stocked with toiletries, a comfortable bed, and a great hot shower. We went to a restaurant that the manager recommended and were among the few tourists there- it was excellent! We were about 2 blocks from P. San Marco and 6 blks from the Rialto. Plenty of shopping nearby for Venitian items as well as Italian designers. The mgr called a water taxi for us and it arrived about a block from the hotel (on time). We would stay ther again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Below average hotel”
Reviews.Author: nytonc2007
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the San Zulian started out great. We arrived at the hotel very early after an overnight train ride. The directions from the vaporetto stop were perfect. At first they told us that the room would be ready at noon. After resting in the lobby for 1/2 hour we were told that our room was ready. Things progressively got worse. The room was dark and cramped for the four of us. The air conditioner, despite numerous complaints, never worked. The next day our room was not made up when we returned from sightseeeing that afternoon. We were told that they would clean it right away. They never cleaned it. There were three different front desk people during our stay: one was great; the other two had condescending attitudes towards us. On the positive side, the breakfast was extremely good. As far as location, if your thing is to be right in the middle of the dense crowds, it's great. If not, there are other neighborhoods to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect small hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ScottNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the San Zulian and we found it to be the perfect small hotel to stay. It has a terrific location, right in the heart of San Marco and Venice. While nothing is easy to find in Venice we did not nearly find it as difficult to find as the reviews we had read. Tip- print off the directions from the San Zulian website and follow those from San Marco Square. Also, it is directly behind the large San Zulian church which is an easy landmark to find or ask someone where it is. Venice is a jewel and we really enjoyed our visit....this hotel and the staff there added to our enjoyment and we hopefully will be returning someday soon! One last thing, if you plan to visit Murano (which I would recommend) the hotel can call for a free boat taxi. Someone will come right to the hotel to take you to the boat and it is a cool, free way to not only get to Murano but take the fun ride in the water taxi. You get to see how the glass is made and then must walk through a showroom of the company that is taking you there. However, it is well worth it. It's interesting to see the process and some of the beautiful pieces they make. We did not find any sales pressure and you can walk right out to explore the island on your own after 10 minutes. You will have to get your own way back after you explore the charming island and its cananls but that is only 6.50 euro and you can catch that water bus from the Colonna Murano stop which is easy to find! Or if you want to go on to Burano, the island famous for its colorful houses and lace you can take the water bus from Faro Murano right to that island.

Reviews.Title: “AVERAGE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: SALLI001
Reviews.Content: When I arrived with my husband and son of 11 years of age at 11pm we were greeted with a miserable, abrupt fellow. We were given the key to room 102 which was small and the ensuite facilities of a shower, bidet, toilet and sink were installed in a tiny room. The toilet seat kept falling down on its own, so watch out for that! The hairdryer was in the bathroom, the wrong place as the room was small and was already very warm with the use of the shower and then to try and dry your hair in this environment was awful. The air-conditioning was very noisy and was not effective. There was not much storage for our clothing so my sons had to stay in his case. The satelite TV was very basic with only the news in various languages and other programmes in Italian. We were advised to have our breakfast in our room as the dining area was very small and could not cater for everyone in the hotel. The impression was that they wanted you to eat in the room. We had the same sheets for the five days we were there, but the towels were changed everyday. The person(s) who delivered the breakfast every morning was very pleasant with a happy out look. The hotel is in the midst of all the tourist activities, you could not hear any of this from our room as we faced into the court yard of the hotel. We found Venice a beatiful city, but very expensive especially in St Marks Square. There were many stalls and shops selling the same things and was boring after a couple of days. The best thing was to explore the less known areas and sit in the various 'squares' which supplied seating that you did not have to pay for!! The hotel did suggest a 'free' trip to see Murano glass being made, we were collected and taken to a water taxi. Upon arrival we were greeted by someone from the glass factory/shop, once he realised we were not interested in buying any of the glass we were dismissed out of hand. Outside we were told if we were to leave now we would be taken back but not to were we had started, so there was a 25 minute walk back to the hotel. The glass was expensive and the same glass was sold in their shops in Venice at a cheaper price! We would definately be going back for a long weekend , but next time we are going top choose a hotel with more facilties and one that is out of the hustle and bustle of St Marks Square.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: MapAndCompass
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel San Zulian in May 2008, in room 107. Our room was clean and pleasant. Although there was no closet or bureau, the room included a nicely-sized wardrobe. The bed was comfortable but the pillows were a bit flatter than what weâ€™re used to. Still, we slept well. The bathroom was clean and the shower rather small, but thatâ€™s how it goes in Europe! The bathroom included a hairdryer, and also a retractable clothesline, should you decide to do in-room laundry. Breakfast could be taken in the ground floor dining area, or could be delivered to your room for no extra charge. We had it delivered each morning, and it included coffee, juice, rolls, croissants filled with cheese, lunch meats and cheeses, packaged wedges of cheese, and butter and jams. The desk clerk will ask you if you want to have your breakfast delivered, what should be included from the above options, and when it should be delivered. Once you tell them, thatâ€™s what theyâ€™ll bring to you each morning at that time â€“ no need to re-order for each day. We said â€œyesâ€� to everything that was available, and it was enough to get us started for our day. For larger appetites it might seem a bit light, but trust me: youâ€™ll be eating gelato at least twice a day anyway (gelato stands are everywhere and look very tempting), so save some calories for later. Thereâ€™s a restaurant across the street from the hotel entrance, and other restaurants and gelato stands are nearby as well. The hotel is located about halfway between St. Markâ€™s Square and the Rialto Bridge shopping area, so the main sights are just a few moments away. If you need a bit of help finding the hotel the first time: Exit St. Markâ€™s Square (Piazza San Marco) under the bell tower and continue straight on that street until you reach the Ferrari Store â€“ you canâ€™t miss it, itâ€™s right in front of you, with a red Ferrari racing car in the front window. Turn right and continue walking until youâ€™re facing a church. Turn right at the church, go around to the back wall of the church (counterclockwise), turn right onto the first street, and the hotel will be immediately on your left. Internet access seemed expensive compared to other hotels in other cities, so we found an internet cafÃ© instead. The front desk staff was helpful and understood English. Each time that you leave the hotel, you need to turn in your key at the front desk. We didnâ€™t know why but it was one less thing to carry, so we didnâ€™t mind. We would certainly stay here again, given the quality and location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: adriananyc
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in between the Piazza San Marco and the Rialto Bridge. Great location, though it is a bit difficult to find as there are no real good maps of Venice's tiny alleyways. Hotel was nice, small, but well-kept. The room had a lovely view of all Venice's house tops - which I actually loved. Although the breakfast room downstairs is small, they bring room service for those guests who don't want to deal with the cramped quarters. Room Service was very prompt and was a substantial continental breakfast. The reception of the hotel was a bit rude - eg. I called to advise them I was a bit lost and they were not very helpful and did not provide me any tips whatsoever. They had a very hands off approach.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Stay Here!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheLobus
Reviews.Content: The owner of this hotel is not fit to run a bath! Small hotel run by about 4 people (Fawlty Towers comes to mind) At 6pm one evening I asked for some hot water to fill a glasss and was told "NO! the bar is closed, it is not possible". "This is hot water we are talking about and you are a hotel"? "Yes but only a 3 star hotel said the owner". Remaining calm and relaxed I explained "1,2 or 3 stars hot water should not be a problem"? The owner, a very obnoxious man who kept reminding me that he owned the hotel was rude, slammed his hand down on the bar and then proceeded to offer me outside his hotel for "fight" just because I insisted for a second time of asking. I never met a more fould mouthed person in my life and when I walked away, slammed the door behind me swearing and cursing at me Stay here at your peril! This ia a 'laughable effort of a hotel!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DazedTourist
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the San Zulian. It is in a brilliant location, just north of St Mark's Square, on the way to the Rialto. We had a spacious and spotless three-bedded room which was very quiet and the staff were helpful. Given the price of the Hotel we had everything we required. The air-conditioning was a little noisy, but it worked.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Italophilia
Reviews.Content: Traveling with our two children and my niece, we stayed in a large suite that accomodated all of us. It was very clean inside, as long as we didn't open the windows -- the pigeons enjoyed sitting on the window sills and left feather and bird poop there. Ignore the guy at the reception area with offers of discounted gondola rides. You can negotiate with the gondolier directly and get as good a price. The rooms and lobby areas were clean and we had an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location vs Comfort”
Reviews.Author: ThePatientEnglishman
Reviews.Content: The San Zulian is marvellously placed,about 150 yards from St Marks' Square, and perfect as a centre for your first tour of Venice. Our room (no. 205 on the third floor) was perfectly clean, nicely decorated with a few genuine Venetian hints (such as the headboard of the bed, the wardrobe and the mirror) and with a pleasant view of pantiled rooftops and a nice bathroom. The bed, however, was concrete-hard and any movement in the rooms above seemed to set the light fitting and the bathroom door creaking and rattling. It was very difficult to get to sleep till the people above had settled down - which wasn't till 2am one night. It sounded as if they were shifting their furniture around for about three hours - which they may have been - but you might not have such bad luck. The breakfast downstairs was minimal but adequate. Considering the price of the room was double that of other, and I now know, better hotels in Venice, I would suggest you'd be better off in a quieter and more interesting area such as Dorsoduro. But, by and large, it was still a pleasant experience and we don't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the con man”
Reviews.Author: a_jarvis19
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have just returned from our stay at the San Zulian Hotel and I have to say that we were both pretty inpressed with the hotel considering the amount money it cost us to stay there. The room we had was a good size considering we were staying in Venice and was also spotless. We stayed in the annex rooms which were located around the corner from the hotels main enterence and contrary to many reviews we had no problems at all getting access to our room we simply buzzed the reception and were let in. I would however be rather concerned if two females were staying in these rooms as the ally way to the door was very poorly lit. The Breakfast was spot on and the staff in general very friendly and accomodating except for one member of staff. Having read an earlier review it seems we were not the only people to be coned by this chap so be warned. Whilst walking through reception on our first morning the man behind the desk claimed to have been asked by another young couple if he could find anyone else to share a gondola with them to split the cost. He then went on to state that the cost of a gondola was around â‚¬120, if we shared one it would only cost us â‚¬60, he however needed the money up front. We later found out that a gondola for just me and my girlfriend would have cost only â‚¬60!! It turned out during our 'shared' gondola ride that the other couple had been fed the same story. Overall our stay was good but the shine was taken off by con man working behind reception, avoid him and his dodgy deals and your sure to enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Neutral about San Zulian”
Reviews.Author: JimmyRichter
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the last weekend of carnival. Great centrally located hotel not far from St. Marks Square. Some staff very good others indifferent. No reason to complain though. All requests were attended to immedately. We were accommodated in the annex on the first floor, about 75 metres away from the main entrance down a quiet passage. Room was adequately furnished and clean but very small. Barely room to pass between the wall and the end of the bed. The great disadvantage we experienced was out of the control of the hotel. On the other side of the passage is the side door to a restaurant kitchen which starts work early in the morning. The cleaners porters and delivery workers made a great racket underneath our window every morning. Nothing we could do about it as it could be classed as "necessary noise". After about 0900 the place was very quiet. C'est la vie!

Reviews.Title: “You could do better staying elsewhere in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Wooders1
Reviews.Content: The Hotel San Zulian was quite disappointing. Having never been to Venice before, I imagine that the hotel itself was very like many others in the city, however what really surprised us was the complete indifference of the hotel reception staff. Rather than be made to feel welcome, we felt more like we were a nusiance to them. Surprising in a city where tourism is the major industry. Our room was not in the main building, but was accessed via an alley at the rear of the hotel. In order to gain entry from the alley, we had to press a button and wait to be let in by the reception staff, then would climb some stairs up to our room. Despite having collected our room key from reception only moments before, we would ring the buzzer to be let in and would wait until someone bothered to release the door for us. Sometimes we had to ring several times before we'd get anyone's attention. The room itself was quite comfortable, but tiny. I think there are probably better accommodation options in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Ugly72
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a beautiful gem of a hotel. I had read some reviews of Hotel San Zulian on trip advisor and decided to book it. Firstly I must say that if you are booking this hotel, request Room 304. I saw this room mentioned on trip advisor and that it had a little attic room so I requested this room. Finding the hotel was relatively easy using instructions from the internet and when we arrived the reception staff mentioned that we had secured the attic room! Getting to the room is via some steep steps (well it is in the attic of the hotel) however the views from this room are amazing - I have attached a photo for you to see. It is not often that you have the rooftops of Venice as your view. What a beautiful way to experience this fantastic city! The room was lovely. Comfortable bed, small but very clean bathroom and airconditioning. Breakfast was served in our room each day however with the extra attic room it was enjoyable way to have breakfast. We were close to a couple of bell towers which rang often and produced the most beautiful sound - especially when we had the view that we did. The hotel is located in central San Marco and all the attractions are within 5 mintues walking distance. I would certainly recommend this hotel however at 330 Euro for two nights it is not cheap but certainly worth it. The staff at reception were lovely and provided assisance willingly - directions to a laundromat, internet cafe, restaurants to eat at. The hotel even provides a complimentary trip to Murano Island by water taxi to observe a glass blower in action. Never did we feel under pressure to buy the glass however we did have to find our own way back from the island! A waterbus was sufficient. I would definately go back to Hotel San Zulian.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Count_Christo
Reviews.Content: Hotel San Zulian was a great place to stay. We booked our room directly with the hotel and the price we received was one of the better ones in Venezia for October. We stayed for 5 days and we were served a contintental breakfast in our room each day. The room was a bit small by North American standards but considering the building space constraints of Venice I can overlook that, it wasn't terrible. The room was very tidy and clean and the bathroom was good as well. The hotel staff were very pleasant and helpful, answering all of our silly tourist questions, which I'm sure they hear a million times a day. The hotel is a quick 2-3 minute walk from St. Mark's Square and is great if you want a central location to explore Venice from. Overall I would rate our experience at the hotel an 8/10. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Barely Okay”
Reviews.Author: cjoanie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very close to San Marco square. Too many tourists in that area. Our room was a very good size for Venice. However, it was dark. My main complaint was the staff. We had a leak in the sink and they could have cared less about it. They were not friendly and helpful with tourist information. Breakfast room was so small, it had to be delivered to our room. I would have preferred to go at my leisure and not be cooped up in a dark room. We actually were locked out of the hotel at 9:15pm and had to ring the bell numerous times to get in. Overall, not worth the money...stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value - try somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: hjdd
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights in Venice, staying at the San Zulian. On the good side - room was clean, hotel staff were helpful and breakfast was good - although not brought to your room as other reviews have suggested. However .... the room was small, two single beds pushed together not a double as requested and booked. Worst of all it was accesed via a dark, smelly alleyway which lead to two rooms without any form of porter or security. The bathroom was tiny, no bath just a shower that was too small to be of any use. Couldn't open the windows due to smells from the kitchen opposite, noise from the alley way and even when opened it was still dark due to the proximity of the buildings opposite. On our first day, I took a shower, which leaked water into the bathroom and into the bedroom. We reported it to the hotel manager who promised to sort it. On returning to our room we found they had not fixed it but had merely cleaned up most of the water, although hadn't cleaned the water from under to bed. A few hours later and much inconveniecne and the shower was eventually fixed. Yes it is close to St Marks, but Venice is so campact that you dont need to be that close. On the second day we discovered the area near the Ponte Accedeemia which has a lovely friendly truly Italian feel, not overly touristy and the best restuarants of our stay were definately found near here. I'm sorry to say that staying at this hotel very nearly runined our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “A Delightful Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I can't recommend this hotel highly enough if you are just looking for a reasonably priced,comfortable, clean, safe and convenient place to sleep. Not much of a view, but that wasn't important to us. It truly is only a hop, skip and a jump from St. Mark's Square. It's a bit tricky to find at first, but once you find your way through the warren of alleys and streets, you'll see it takes literally about 3 minutes to get back to the heart of Venice. The hotel was spotlessly clean, the front desk staff exceedingly helpful and friendly, the room was definitely large enough for us (and our 2 weeks worth of junk)and the bathroom, while tight, was generous compared to others we had on our trip. We actually stayed in Venice before and after our cruise; the second weekend we stayed in the Rialto Bridge area. That was nice also, quite a bit less hectic ... but we wished we had returned to Hotel San Zulian. Yes, it's right in the hustle and bustle, but the rooms are soundproof and we didn't hear a thing. We loved having breakfast brought to us in the morning; it added to the luxurious feeling of being in Venice! And no, the hotel is not "near" the canals... but trust me, you'll see the canals all day long -- you don't really need to pay lots more to see them from your hotel room! And really, nothing is far from a canal in Venice... if you can't see a canal, just walk another 5 feet and you'll see one!You will love this hotel and its convenient location, especially if you are just arriving from the airport with all your bags. (Word of advice... pack light! It can be tough rolling your suitcase on the cobbled stones, and around people in the narrow streets) There's a great little stand-up or take-away pizza place behind the hotel - highly recommend for a good, quick, cheap meal! We went on the free hotel-sponsored trip to Murano and had an escorted tour through the the Gritti factory & museum/gift shop. Obviously the guide was on commisssion but believe it or not, there was no sales pressure and we enjoyed the experience. It doesn't cost much to take the ACTV watertaxi out to Murano; you definitely should make time to see the glassblowers in action and the incredible selection of glass products in the factory showcases. We thought it was a lovely little island, and some of our best canal photos were taken here. Again, I can't recommend this hotel highly enough for price-conscious travellers. I don't mean that it's a low budget hotel, not at all! It's just a very good buy for your money when you look at the price, location, convenience, customer service and accomodations. (Dan & Amanda, Raleigh NC October 29, 2005)

Reviews.Title: “Smallest room ever!”
Reviews.Author: SBMPG
Reviews.Content: I have holidayed in Europe before, but I have to say that the room at the San Zulian was the tiniest room I have ever stayed in in my life! We literally had to turn sideways to get passed the bed. It was also dark and gloomy all day - probably because the window opened onto a rather close brick wall! We entered not through the hotel, but down a little dark alleyway that I wouldn't send anyone down alone after dark. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem near St Marks Square - get the attic room if you can!”
Reviews.Author: SVH
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to Venice and we wanted to stay near St Marks Square. We used TripAdvisor and found the San Zulian and in particular were recommended to get the attic room - and what a great piece of advice that turned out to be! The hotel itself is very well located in a small street off St Marks Square. The reception area is elegant but simple and service is very good. The attic room has a small verandah which has been glazed, giving you an all weather viewing room from which to survey the romantic city rooftops and bell towers. On Sunday mornings, you can lie in bed and listen to the bells of the many churches. Another huge plus was breakfast served in our room, every day, at no extra charge. I believe this is due to the hotel having either a very small or non existent dining room - they don't serve any meals other than breakfast. This was a huge bonus for us and breakfast in bed became a week long luxury. The hotel's excellent location meant we were within walking distance of many sights, restaurants and cafes so the lack of dining facilities in the hotel was irrelevant. Highly recommended (and we are very fussy!). This is not a huge luxury hotel, but it has such a great location and the attic room is such a gem, that it is quite unusual and wonderful. One word of caution, the stairs leading to the room were very narrow and steep and could present a problem for the infirm or very young. But all able bodied honeymooners should find it a treat!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FanJet
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located and a very convenient home base. Nicely decorated, comfortable rooms with all the amenities. Beautiful public areas, modern elevator, excellent breakfast, friendly and helpful staff. Everyone at the front desk went out of their way to make our stay in Venice just perfect. Orignally booked for 4 nights we extended our stay to 10 nights because this was the best hotel we encountered on our sojourn in Italy. I feel we have made some new friends at the San Zulian and look forward to our next visit. Highly recommended. You won't go wrong!!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel San Zulian
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco 527, 30124 Venice, Italy
